snippet: The announcement was accompanied by a sense of  acquiescence as the city prepares to hand over the school system to Mayor-elect Bill de Blasio, who has pledged to do away with the ratings.
abstract: Bloomberg administration releases its final batch of grades for more than 1,600 public schools; 63 percent of schools across city received A's and B's, and there were signs that schools were better preparing students for college; announcement is accompanied by sense of acquiescence as city prepares to hand over school system to Mayor-elect Bill de Blasio, who has pledged to do away with ratings.
lead_paragraph: The announcement was accompanied by a sense of  acquiescence as the city prepares to hand over the school system to Mayor-elect Bill de Blasio, who has pledged to do away with the ratings.

headline.main: Bloomberg Issues Final Letter Grades for New York Schools
headline.print_headline: Mayor Issues His Final A’s and B’s as Schools Prepare for New Direction
